page.title: 17EPSOM PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {Epsom Parish Church is dedicated to {St.Martin of Tours and dates back to {before the Domesday survey.}Since 1058 the church has been rebuilt 3 times. In 1908 Sir Charles Nicholson rebuilt most of the church. There are many interesting things to see within the church's grounds, for example the{Vinegar Bible,}printed in 1717 in Oxford. This was one of the largest and costliest additions of the Bible ever printed. It gets its name from a printing error in the parable of the "vinegar". There is also an old Spanish, mahogany chest, beautifully carved, which was salvaged from the old Nonsuch Palace. The stone font dates from around 1460. The church is heavily involved in contributing to charity and one of its latest appeals has been for the Ethiopian famine.
